verses.verse: Now Jacob <S%H3290><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> that there was <S%H3426><s%> grain <S%H7668><s%> in Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> and Jacob <S%H3290><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to his sons, <S%H1121><s%> "Why do you look at one another? <S%H7200><s%>"

He said, <S%H559><s%> "Behold, <S%H8085><s%> I have heard that there is <S%H3426><s%> grain <S%H7668><s%> in Egypt. <S%H4714><s%> Go down <S%H3381><s%> there, <S%H7666><s%> and buy for us from there, <S%H2421><s%> so that we may live, and not die. <S%H4191><s%>"
Joseph <S%H3130><s%>'s ten <S%H6235><s%> brothers <S%H251><s%> went down <S%H3381><s%> to buy <S%H7666><s%> grain <S%H1250><s%> from Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>

But Jacob <S%H3290><s%> didn't <S%H7971><s%> send Benjamin, <S%H1144><s%> Joseph <S%H3130><s%>'s brother, <S%H251><s%> with his brothers; <S%H251><s%> for he said, <S%H559><s%> "Lest perhaps <S%H6435><s%> harm <S%H611><s%> happen to him. <S%H7122><s%>"

The sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> came <S%H935><s%> to buy <S%H7666><s%> among <S%H8432><s%> those who came, <S%H935><s%> for the famine <S%H7458><s%> was in the land <S%H776><s%> of Canaan. <S%H3667><s%>

Joseph <S%H3130><s%> was the governor <S%H7989><s%> over the land. <S%H776><s%> It was he who sold <S%H7666><s%> to all the people <S%H5971><s%> of the land. <S%H776><s%> Joseph <S%H3130><s%>'s brothers <S%H251><s%> came, <S%H935><s%> and bowed themselves down <S%H7812><s%> to him with their faces <S%H639><s%> to the earth <S%H776><s%>

Joseph <S%H3130><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> his brothers, <S%H251><s%> and he recognized <S%H5234><s%> them, <S%H5234><s%> but acted like a stranger to them, <S%H1696><s%> and spoke roughly <S%H7186><s%> with them. <S%H559><s%> He said to them, <S%H370><s%> "Where did you come <S%H935><s%> from? <S%H559><s%>" They said, "From the land <S%H776><s%> of Canaan <S%H3667><s%> to buy <S%H7666><s%> food. <S%H400><s%>"
Joseph <S%H3130><s%> recognized <S%H5234><s%> his brothers, <S%H251><s%> but they didn't <S%H5234><s%> recognize him.

Joseph <S%H3130><s%> remembered <S%H2142><s%> the dreams <S%H2472><s%> which he dreamed <S%H2492><s%> about them, <S%H559><s%> and said to them, <S%H7270><s%> "You are spies! You have come <S%H935><s%> to see <S%H7200><s%> the nakedness <S%H6172><s%> of the land. <S%H776><s%>"
They said <S%H559><s%> to him, <S%H113><s%> "No, my lord, but your servants <S%H5650><s%> have come <S%H935><s%> to buy <S%H7666><s%> food. <S%H400><s%>
We <S%H5168><s%> are all one <S%H259><s%> man <S%H376><s%>'s sons; <S%H1121><s%> we are honest <S%H3651><s%> men. <S%H5650><s%> Your servants are not spies. <S%H7270><s%>"
He said <S%H559><s%> to them, <S%H935><s%> "No, but you have come to see <S%H7200><s%> the nakedness <S%H6172><s%> of the land! <S%H776><s%>"

They said, <S%H559><s%> "We, <S%H5650><s%> your servants, are twelve <S%H8147><s%> brothers, <S%H251><s%> the sons <S%H1121><s%> of one <S%H259><s%> man <S%H376><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Canaan; <S%H3667><s%> and behold, <S%H6996><s%> the youngest is this day <S%H3117><s%> with our father, <S%H1><s%> and one is no more. <S%H259><s%>"
Joseph <S%H3130><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to them, <S%H1696><s%> "It is like I told you, <S%H559><s%> saying, <S%H7270><s%> 'You are spies!'

By <S%H2063><s%> this you shall be tested. <S%H974><s%> By the life <S%H2416><s%> of Pharaoh, <S%H6547><s%> you shall not go out <S%H3318><s%> from here, <S%H6996><s%> unless your youngest brother <S%H251><s%> comes here. <S%H935><s%>

Send <S%H7971><s%> one <S%H259><s%> of you, <S%H3947><s%> and let him get your brother, <S%H251><s%> and you shall be bound, <S%H631><s%> that your words <S%H1697><s%> may be tested, <S%H974><s%> whether there is truth <S%H571><s%> in <S%H854><s%> you, <S%H3808><s%> or else by the life <S%H2416><s%> of Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> surely you are spies. <S%H7270><s%>"
He put them all together <S%H622><s%> into custody <S%H4929><s%> for three <S%H7969><s%> days. <S%H3117><s%>
Joseph <S%H3130><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to them the third <S%H7992><s%> day, <S%H3117><s%> "Do <S%H6213><s%> this, <S%H2421><s%> and live, for I fear <S%H3373><s%> God. <S%H430><s%>

If you are honest <S%H3651><s%> men, <S%H259><s%> then let one of your brothers <S%H251><s%> be bound <S%H631><s%> in your <S%H1004><s%> prison; <S%H4929><s%> but you go, <S%H3212><s%> carry <S%H935><s%> grain <S%H7668><s%> for the famine <S%H7459><s%> of your houses. <S%H1004><s%>
Bring <S%H935><s%> your youngest <S%H6996><s%> brother <S%H251><s%> to me; <S%H1697><s%> so will your words be verified, <S%H539><s%> and you won't <S%H4191><s%> die." They did so. <S%H6213><s%>

They said <S%H559><s%> one <S%H376><s%> to another, <S%H251><s%> "We are certainly <S%H61><s%> guilty <S%H818><s%> concerning our brother, <S%H251><s%> in that <S%H834><s%> we saw <S%H7200><s%> the distress <S%H6869><s%> of his soul, <S%H5315><s%> when he begged <S%H2603><s%> us, <S%H8085><s%> and we wouldn't listen. Therefore this distress <S%H6869><s%> has come upon us. <S%H935><s%>"

Reuben <S%H7205><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> them, <S%H559><s%> saying, "Didn't <S%H559><s%> I tell you, <S%H559><s%> saying, <S%H2398><s%> 'Don't sin against the child, <S%H3206><s%>' and you wouldn't <S%H8085><s%> listen? Therefore also, <S%H1818><s%> behold, his blood is required. <S%H1875><s%>"
They didn't <S%H3045><s%> know that Joseph <S%H3130><s%> understood <S%H8085><s%> them; <S%H3887><s%> for there was an interpreter between them.

He turned himself away <S%H5437><s%> from them, <S%H1058><s%> and wept. Then he returned to them, <S%H7725><s%> and spoke <S%H1696><s%> to them, <S%H3947><s%> and took Simeon <S%H8095><s%> from among them, <S%H631><s%> and bound him before their eyes. <S%H5869><s%>

Then Joseph <S%H3130><s%> gave a command <S%H6680><s%> to fill <S%H4390><s%> their bags <S%H3627><s%> with grain, <S%H1250><s%> and to restore <S%H7725><s%> each man <S%H376><s%>'s money <S%H3701><s%> into his sack, <S%H8242><s%> and to give <S%H5414><s%> them food <S%H6720><s%> for the way. <S%H1870><s%> So <S%H3651><s%> it was done to them. <S%H6213><s%>
They loaded <S%H5375><s%> their donkeys <S%H2543><s%> with their grain, <S%H7668><s%> and departed from there. <S%H3212><s%>

As one <S%H259><s%> of them opened <S%H6605><s%> his sack <S%H8242><s%> to give <S%H5414><s%> his donkey <S%H2543><s%> food <S%H4554><s%> in the lodging place, <S%H4411><s%> he saw <S%H7200><s%> his money. <S%H3701><s%> Behold, <S%H6310><s%> it was in the mouth of his sack. <S%H572><s%>

He said <S%H559><s%> to his brothers, <S%H251><s%> "My money <S%H3701><s%> is restored! <S%H7725><s%> Behold, <S%H2009><s%> it is in my sack! <S%H572><s%>" Their hearts <S%H3820><s%> failed <S%H3318><s%> them, <S%H2729><s%> and they turned trembling one <S%H376><s%> to another, <S%H251><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "What is this that God <S%H430><s%> has done to us? <S%H6213><s%>"

They came <S%H935><s%> to Jacob <S%H3290><s%> their father, <S%H1><s%> to the land <S%H776><s%> of Canaan, <S%H3667><s%> and told <S%H5046><s%> him all that had happened <S%H7136><s%> to them, <S%H559><s%> saying,

"The man, <S%H376><s%> the lord <S%H113><s%> of the land, <S%H776><s%> spoke <S%H1696><s%> roughly <S%H7186><s%> with us, <S%H5414><s%> and took us for spies <S%H7270><s%> of the country. <S%H776><s%>
We said <S%H559><s%> to him, <S%H3651><s%> 'We are honest men. <S%H7270><s%> We are no spies.

We are twelve <S%H6240><s%> brothers, <S%H251><s%> sons <S%H1121><s%> of our father; <S%H1><s%> one <S%H259><s%> is no more, <S%H6996><s%> and the youngest is this day <S%H3117><s%> with our father <S%H1><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Canaan. <S%H3667><s%>'

The man, <S%H376><s%> the lord <S%H113><s%> of the land, <S%H776><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to us, <S%H3045><s%> 'By this I will know that you are honest <S%H3651><s%> men: <S%H3240><s%> leave one <S%H259><s%> of your brothers <S%H251><s%> with me, <S%H3947><s%> and take grain for the famine <S%H7459><s%> of your houses, <S%H1004><s%> and go your way. <S%H3212><s%>

Bring <S%H935><s%> your youngest <S%H6996><s%> brother <S%H251><s%> to me. <S%H3045><s%> Then I will know that you are not spies, <S%H7270><s%> but that you are honest <S%H3651><s%> men. <S%H5414><s%> So I will deliver your brother <S%H251><s%> to you, <S%H5503><s%> and you shall trade in the land. <S%H776><s%>'"

It happened as they emptied <S%H7324><s%> their sacks, <S%H8242><s%> that behold, <S%H376><s%> each man's bundle <S%H6872><s%> of money <S%H3701><s%> was in his sack. <S%H8242><s%> When they and their father <S%H1><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> their bundles <S%H6872><s%> of money, <S%H3701><s%> they were afraid. <S%H3372><s%>

Jacob, <S%H3290><s%> their father, <S%H1><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to them, <S%H7921><s%> "You have bereaved me of my sons Joseph <S%H3130><s%> is no more, <S%H8095><s%> Simeon is no more, <S%H3947><s%> and you want to take Benjamin away. <S%H1144><s%> All these things are against me."

Reuben <S%H7205><s%> spoke <S%H559><s%> to his father, <S%H1><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "Kill <S%H4191><s%> my two <S%H8147><s%> sons, <S%H1121><s%> if I don't <S%H935><s%> bring him to you. <S%H5414><s%> Entrust him to my care, <S%H3027><s%> and I will bring him to you again. <S%H7725><s%>"

He said, <S%H559><s%> "My son <S%H1121><s%> shall not go down <S%H3381><s%> with you; <S%H251><s%> for his brother is dead, <S%H4191><s%> and he only is left. <S%H7604><s%> If harm <S%H611><s%> happens <S%H7122><s%> to him along the way <S%H1870><s%> in which you go, <S%H3212><s%> then you will bring down <S%H3381><s%> my gray hairs <S%H7872><s%> with sorrow <S%H3015><s%> to Sheol. <S%H7585><s%>"
